title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 189.1 - Findings and purpose
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 189.1 - Findings and purpose

State Regulations

The Department of Environmental Conservation hereby finds
that chronic wasting disease, a fatal transmissible neurodegenerative disease
threatens the health and welfare of wildlife populations and captive cervids. The nature of chronic wasting disease requires prompt and extraordinary actions
to address the threat posed by this disease. The purpose of this rule is to
prevent re-introduction of this disease into New York, to contain the spread of
this disease within New York if present, and to protect the health of wild
white-tailed deer (Odocoileus virginianus) and wild moose (Alces alces) in New

York. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
189.1

Amended

New

York State Register November 13, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 46, eff. 11/13/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
